page.title: 13The Cat and Man Legend.
page.content: Sir Percival Cresacre was returning home to Barnburgh Hall from Doncaster where he had been visiting the Fraternity of Grey Friars. He was mounted on his favourite mare, Winifred, who had carried him through many a severe chase and danger. His journey led him through thick woodland where the cries of foxs and wolves could be heard. When he reached Melton Hill he paused and surveyed the scene. He saw the thin light on the horizon, a canopy of dark clouds, and the river to the far right reflected a faint light. He cantered down the hill, through the trees towards Ludwell Spring. Suddenly out of the darkness, a huge wild cat sprang and sank its sharp claws into Winifreds flesh. Winifred reared and plunged madly onwards,but the cat clung on.
